title: Wimbledon 2023 results: Katie Boulter loses to Elena Rybakina
description: Katie Boulter's bid to reach the Wimbledon last 16 for the first time ends quickly as she is outclassed by defending champion Elena Rybakina.

title: Tour de France: Sadness and tears as Mark Cavendish breaks collarbone in Tour-ending crash
description: Race director Christian Prudhomme says "the Tour de France is sad" after Mark Cavendish crashes out on stage eight.

title: The Ashes 2023: England chasing 251 to keep Ashes hopes alive
description: England need another 224 runs to win the third Test and keep their Ashes hopes alive after a thrilling rain-shortened third day Headingley.

title: The Ashes highlights: England v Australia - third Test, day three
description: England need another 224 runs to win the third Test and keep their Ashes hopes alive after a thrilling rain-shortened third day at Headingley.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Alejandro Fokina, Natalija Stevanovic & Tommy Paul star in shots of the day
description: Watch the best shots from day six of Wimbledon featuring Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, Natalija Stevanovic and Tommy Paul.

title: Megan Rapinoe: USA midfielder to retire from football at end of NWSL season
description: USA forward Megan Rapinoe, one of the most successful players of her generation, says she will retire at the end of the season.

title: Tour de France: Mark Cavendish breaks collarbone in Tour-ending crash
description: Mark Cavendish breaks a collarbone as he crashes out of what is set to be his final Tour de France before retirement.

title: Alcaraz wins thriller to match best Wimbledon run
description: World number one Carlos Alcaraz holds off a spirited challenge from Nicolas Jarry to move into the last 16 - and match his best Wimbledon run.

title: The Ashes: Moeen Ali's 'sliding tackle' prevents boundary
description: England all-rounder Moeen Ali slides in to prevent a Todd Murphy boundary with his feet during day three of the third Ashes Test at Headingley.

title: Cluster bombs: Unease grows over US sending cluster bombs to Ukraine
description: Washington is supplying the weapons to Kyiv, but they are outlawed in more than 100 countries.

title: Wimbledon school crash: Residents and former pupil pay tribute
description: A former pupil at The Study in Wimbledon says the school is a tightly knit community.

title: Rishi Sunak says the UK discourages use of cluster bombs in Ukraine
description: The UK is one the countries which bans the weapons but will continue to support Ukraine, PM says.

title: Public sector pay rises should be affordable - PM
description: Rishi Sunak said it would be "short-sighted" to do something now that made inflation worse later.

title: Watch: Are Saturday's thunderstorms here to stay?
description: Matt Taylor gives the forecast for the next few days after thunderstorms hit parts of the UK.

title: British Grand Prix: Max Verstappen pips Lando Norris to pole
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen steals pole position from McLaren's Lando Norris in a gripping and surprising qualifying session at the British Grand Prix.

title: Stradey Park Hotel: Asylum control lost, claims Llanelli councillor
description: Dozens of protesters, for and against the plans, gather outside a hotel set to house asylum seekers.

title: Laura Kuenssberg: Why you should not expect a cheque book election
description: It is harder to make big promises when there is less cash to go around, says Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Wealthier might have to pay more for BBC - ex-chairman Richard Sharp
description: The former BBC chairman, who resigned in April, says the licence fee system is "regressive".

title: Ukraine war: Eight killed in Russian strike in Lyman, say authorities
description: Another five people were wounded in the Russian shelling in the Donetsk town, authorities say.

title: Janet Yellen asks China to co-operate on climate change action
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen calls on Beijing to invest more in efforts to transition from fossil fuels.

title: West Mersea: Murder charge over married couple's death
description: A man is charged with murder in connection with the deaths of Stephen and Carol Baxter in Essex.

title: Pig fed junk food for seven years in small flat
description: Portia the pot-bellied pig who could barely walk after reaching 26 stone is given a new lease of life.

title: AI robot asked 'will you rebel against humans'?
description: The question was posed at the world's first robot-human press conference at a UN summit in Geneva.

title: Captain Sir Tom Moore: What has happened to his legacy?
description: How much money did Captain Tom raise and why is his family under the spotlight?

title: Jazmin Sawyers: GB athlete on the need for more women-specific sport science research
description: In her second BBC Sport column, GB long jumper Jazmin Sawyers discusses the potentially career-altering need for more women-specific sport science research.

title: France riots: Can Paris prevent tensions igniting again?
description: The riots in the country's suburban estates have subsided, for now, but deep divisions remain.

title: Insects find their way onto Italian plates despite resistance
description: Pulverising crickets to make flour for food is seen by some as a threat to the Mediterranean diet.

title: Evan Gershkovich: US confirms Russia contact over prisoner swap for reporter
description: The White House says it is prepared to do "hard things" to free the American journalist from Russia.

title: Ford Fiesta fans on why they love their cars
description: As Ford announces the end of the Fiesta, keen fans sing its praises and mourn its loss.

title: Belarus camp offered to Wagner: BBC's Steve Rosenberg visits
description: The BBC's Russia editor says that, so far, only Belarusian troops appear to be at the camp.

title: Cluster bombs: Biden defends decision to send Ukraine controversial weapons
description: The weapons have a record of killing civilians - and the president said sending them was a difficult decision.

title: West End play poster banned by TfL over 'unhealthy' cake
description: Transport for London said the poster promoted "foods high in fat, salt and sugar".
